p: During the study period from September 2015 to March 2016, 104 children aged between 1 and 115 months were enrolled and screened for DENV, CHIKV, ZIKV, YFV, RVFVâ€”Seventy-nine were <5 years old, and 42 (40,38%) were male ( Supplementary Data 1). Regarding clinical symptoms, the most common symptoms after fever were, respectively, rhinorrhea (65%), cough (53%; 55/104), vomiting (25%; 26/104), diarrhoea (25%; 25/104) and abdominal pain (25%; 26/104). Headaches were reported only in 10% of the enrolled patients, while myalgia and arthralgia were not recorded at all ( Figure 3).
